definitions: person who works in the petroleum industry extracting or selling oil
examples: The oilman spent months on the offshore drilling platform
Several oilmen gathered to discuss the new extraction technology

definitions: smooth oily substance applied to skin for healing or protection
examples: She applied the antibiotic ointment to the wound twice daily
The doctor prescribed a special ointment for the skin condition

definitions: giraffe relative with striped legs living in Central African rainforests
examples: The okapi remained hidden in the dense Congo forest
Scientists discovered that okapis are closely related to giraffes

definitions: green pod vegetable used in cooking especially in Southern and African cuisines
examples: She added fresh okra to the gumbo for authentic flavor
The farmers market had bundles of okra for sale

definitions: poisonous evergreen shrub with pink or white flowers common in warm climates
examples: The pink oleander bloomed beautifully along the garden path
Gardeners must handle oleander carefully due to its toxic properties

definitions: member of small group holding power especially through business wealth and political influence
examples: The oligarch controlled several major industries in the country
Russian oligarchs gained enormous wealth after the Soviet collapse

definitions: government system where power is held by small group of wealthy or influential people
examples: The nation transformed from democracy into an oligarchy over decades
Critics argued the oligarchy served only elite interests

definitions: appointed official who investigates complaints against organizations especially government agencies or companies
examples: The ombudsman reviewed hundreds of citizen complaints each year
She contacted the ombudsman about unfair treatment by the agency

definitions: last letter of the Greek alphabet
final or last part of a series or process
examples: The omega symbol represents the end in Greek
Scientists use omega to denote angular velocity in physics
He considered retirement the omega of his long career
The project reached its omega phase after three years

definitions: beaten eggs cooked in pan and folded often with fillings
examples: She made a cheese omelette for breakfast every Sunday
The chef prepared a mushroom omelette with fresh herbs

definitions: fifteenth letter of the Greek alphabet used in mathematics and science
examples: The omicron variant of the virus spread rapidly worldwide
Students learned to write omicron in their Greek alphabet lesson

definitions: something left out or excluded either deliberately or by mistake from text or action
examples: The omission of her name from the list upset her greatly
Several important omissions were found in the contract draft

definitions: quality of having unlimited power and ability to do anything especially attributed to deities
examples: Many religions describe their god's omnipotence over the universe
The dictator's belief in his omnipotence led to his downfall

definitions: state of knowing everything that exists or happens especially as divine attribute
examples: The novel's narrator possessed an omniscience about all characters
Religious texts often describe divine omniscience watching over humanity

definitions: animal that eats both plants and meat as regular parts of its diet
examples: Humans are omnivores capable of digesting various food types
Bears are omnivores eating berries and salmon with equal enthusiasm

definitions: medical doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating cancer using various therapies
examples: The oncologist recommended a combination of chemotherapy and radiation
She consulted with several oncologists before choosing her treatment plan

definitions: branch of medicine dealing with prevention diagnosis and treatment of cancer
examples: He decided to specialize in oncology after medical school
The hospital's oncology department uses the latest treatment technologies

definitions: movement of vehicles or objects coming toward observer especially on roads
examples: The driver swerved to avoid the oncoming traffic
Bright headlights from oncoming cars made it difficult to see

definitions: word that phonetically imitates the sound it describes like buzz or bang
examples: Comic books use onomatopoeia like 'pow' and 'zap' frequently
The word 'sizzle' is onomatopoeia for cooking sounds

definitions: start or beginning of something especially unpleasant like disease or weather
examples: The onset of winter brought heavy snow to the region
Early treatment at the onset of symptoms improves recovery chances

definitions: destructive attack or assault that is sudden violent and overwhelming in force
examples: The castle walls crumbled under the enemy's relentless onslaught
She faced an onslaught of criticism after the controversial decision

definitions: semiprecious stone with parallel bands of different colors often black and white
examples: The jeweler crafted an elegant ring from black onyx
Ancient Romans carved cameos from layers of onyx stone

definitions: slow seepage of thick liquid from or through something
examples: Mud began to ooze between the wooden floorboards
The wound continued to ooze despite the bandage

definitions: quality of being opaque preventing light from passing through making something unclear
examples: The window's opacity provided privacy from outside viewers
Doctors examined the lung opacity visible on the X-ray

definitions: precious stone displaying shifting rainbow colors formed from hydrated silica
examples: The Australian opal shimmered with blue and green fire
Her grandmother's opal necklace became a family heirloom

definitions: tool for opening containers especially bottles or cans
first act or event in a series or performance
examples: He searched the drawer for the bottle opener
The electric can opener made meal preparation much easier
The comedian served as the opener for the main act
Their season opener against the champions proved challenging

definitions: person engaged in secret intelligence or detective work
worker involved in practical or surgical operations
examples: The operative gathered intelligence behind enemy lines
Government operatives infiltrated the criminal organization
The surgical operative prepared instruments for the procedure
Several operatives worked efficiently on the factory floor

definitions: short comic opera with spoken dialogue and popular melodies
examples: Gilbert and Sullivan wrote many beloved operettas together
The community theater performed a charming operetta this summer

definitions: medical doctor specializing in eye and vision care including surgery and disease treatment
examples: The ophthalmologist performed cataract surgery with great precision
Regular visits to an ophthalmologist help maintain healthy vision

definitions: drug containing opium or its derivatives used to relieve pain and induce sleep
examples: Doctors carefully monitor opiate prescriptions due to addiction risks
The patient required stronger opiates after the major surgery

definitions: dried latex from poppy plants containing morphine used as narcotic and medicine source
examples: Opium trade shaped nineteenth century Asian politics significantly
Ancient physicians used opium to treat severe pain

definitions: nocturnal marsupial with pointed snout and prehensile tail native to Americas
examples: The opossum played dead when threatened by the dog
Opossums help control pests by eating ticks and insects

definitions: practice of taking advantage of circumstances with little regard for principles or consequences
examples: Political opportunism led him to switch parties for personal gain
Her opportunism in business dealings damaged professional relationships

definitions: person who exploits circumstances for personal gain without regard for principles
examples: The opportunist quickly changed sides when power shifted
Career opportunists often lack genuine commitment to causes

definitions: prolonged cruel treatment or control exercised by authority causing hardship and injustice
examples: The oppression of minorities sparked nationwide protests
Centuries of oppression finally ended with the revolution

definitions: person or group that rules harshly keeping others under cruel control
examples: The oppressor faced justice after years of brutal rule
History remembers both oppressors and those who resisted them

definitions: component relating to eyes or vision especially in technical or medical contexts
examples: The optic nerve carries visual information to the brain
Damage to optic fibers can cause permanent vision loss

definitions: professional who fits and sells corrective lenses and eyeglass frames
examples: The optician adjusted the frames for a comfortable fit
She visited the optician to order new prescription lenses

definitions: process of making something as effective or functional as possible
examples: Website optimisation improved loading speeds significantly
The team focused on optimisation of manufacturing processes

definitions: hopefulness and confidence about future outcomes believing good things will happen
examples: Her optimism helped the team through difficult challenges
Despite setbacks, he maintained optimism about the project

definitions: person who tends to be hopeful and expects favorable outcomes
examples: The eternal optimist always found silver linings in problems
Optimists generally report higher life satisfaction than pessimists

definitions: process of making something as effective or functional as possible
examples: Code optimization reduced the program's memory usage considerably
Supply chain optimization saved the company millions annually

definitions: most favorable conditions or level for growth performance or success
examples: Scientists determined the optimum temperature for enzyme activity
The athlete trained to reach optimum fitness before competition
